Scholars were sor years face to face with this perplexing tangle of evidences‚ when, in 1898, Professor Paul Sabatier noticed that a certain MS. in the library at Assisi contained a page that seemed to have no bearing upon the other sheets.

After careful study‚ he came to the conclusion that the page of MS. 338 of Assisi was apage of the long-lost Miracles of Thomas of celano, written about 1257. Students, too, were con- stantly coming across extracts in the later writers of what seemed to them the lost version of the Miracles of St. F rancis.

The excitement and perplexity increased, when suddenly the clue was discovered.
